channel.title: Brian the Build Bunny
channel.description: I'm always keen try new and novel ways to keep in touch with the status of my software projects. Fortunately, Team Foundation Server provides many ways to do this. While the Build Wallboard is fun if you have a spare...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by ET+00:00
item.description:
I LOVE IT!!! I WANT ONE!!!
Cheers,
ET
item.dc:creator: ET

item.title: Comment by Greg Duncan+00:00
item.description:
LOL... That rocks.
I want a Build Bunny now! Do you think we could talk MS into giving some away at PDC? ;)
Thanks for posting this. :)
item.dc:creator: Greg Duncan

item.title: Comment by rr+00:00
item.description:
"your bunny TFS..."
(by analogy with "your bunny wrote.." and used to be said by russian developers..)
item.dc:creator: rr

item.title: Comment by Martin Woodward+00:00
item.description: I suspect that "your bunny VSS" would be a more common phrase ;-)
item.dc:creator: Martin Woodward

item.title: Comment by Mac Noland+00:00
item.description: I love it Martin! You continue to amaze me!!! I think Thomson Reuters might need a "Build Bunny!"
item.dc:creator: Mac Noland

item.title: Comment by Ed Blankenship+00:00
item.description: Wow Martin this is great. I love it. Please do share some code wisdom when you get the chance... I think I'm going to order one now!
item.dc:creator: Ed Blankenship

item.title: Comment by Fabian Crabus+00:00
item.description:
The Nabaztags are great. We've already two of them. Especially funny if they're trying to speak German.
More in German: http://www.agimatec.de/blog/2008/04/talking-builds-oder-killerhase-im-schafspelz/
item.dc:creator: Fabian Crabus

item.title: Comment by Dave Largen+00:00
item.description: I would love to get an overview of the code you use to control Brian with TFS. I just convinced my boss to order one for our office.
item.dc:creator: Dave Largen

item.title: Comment by Simon Tiffert+00:00
item.dc:creator: Simon Tiffert

item.title: Comment by Matt Poland+00:00
item.description:
I just started a .Net-based API over at CodePlex.
http://www.codeplex.com/NabaztagLib
item.dc:creator: Matt Poland

item.title: Comment by John O'Neill+00:00
item.description:
I smell a killer app. :)
Martin, I'll be calling later to license the IP rights for North America. I'm off to call China to find a factory...
- John
item.dc:creator: John O'Neill

item.title: Comment by Fabrice BARBIN+00:00
item.description:
Nabaztag rabbits are awesome!!
I just launched NabazGroove, a playful application to connect Microsoft Office Groove 2007 with a Nabaztag.
If you are interested, you can have a look here: http://blog.fbarbin.com/nabazgroove/
(NabazGroove will also be demoed during TechED Dev at Barcelona)
item.dc:creator: Fabrice BARBIN

item.title: Comment by Elbert van Eck+00:00
item.description:
he i'm a student from the netherlands i study application development i resently baught an nabaztag i am very interested in the code used for this project so i hope you can email me the files you used to make this happen i would really appriciate it
thanks in advance
Elbert van Eck
item.dc:creator: Elbert van Eck
